docs.snippet: Chicago is 2-0 after an off-season in which it let go of Coach Lovie Smith and Brian Urlacher, the face of the franchise....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chicago is 2-0 after an off-season in which it let go of Coach Lovie Smith and Brian Urlacher, the face of the franchise.
docs.abstract: Analysis; Chicago Bears are 2-0 following off-season in which management drew scrutiny for letting go coach Lovie Smith and player Brian Urlacher; fans have become less critical in face of newfound success.

headline.main: Tough Calls Are Paying Off for the Bears
headline.print_headline: Tough Calls Are Paying Off For the Bears

docs.snippet: The writer lobbied his parents for a chance to play tackle football when he turned 8, but, he says, because it worked out well for him does not mean it will work out well for everyone....
docs.lead_paragraph: The writer lobbied his parents for a chance to play tackle football when he turned 8, but, he says, because it worked out well for him does not mean it will work out well for everyone.
docs.abstract: Scott Fujita essay explores his conflicted feelings, as former NFL linebacker, about children's  football programs, saying that he would have deep reservations about letting his children play despite sport's importance in his own life; describes mounting anxiety he felt during his professional career as he watched colleagues succumb to concussion-related brain diseases.

headline.main: Would I Let My Son Play Football?
headline.print_headline: Would I Let My Son Play Football?

docs.snippet: The price of the most expensive tickets for the Super Bowl next February will more than double, to about $2,600 apiece...
docs.lead_paragraph: The price of the most expensive tickets for the Super Bowl next February will more than double, to about $2,600 apiece
docs.abstract: NFL Roundup; NFL announces that it will raise prices for most expensive seats at 2014 Super Bowl to about $2,600 each, up from $1,250 in previous year; other football news noted.

headline.main: Costliest Super Bowl Tickets Will Become Even Pricier
headline.print_headline: Costliest Super Bowl Tickets Will Become Even Pricier

docs.snippet: The Northwestern Wildcats are not only undefeated this year, they are well-rested thanks to a regimen that emphasizes good sleeping habits....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Northwestern Wildcats are not only undefeated this year, they are well-rested thanks to a regimen that emphasizes good sleeping habits.
docs.abstract: Northwestern Wildcats football team has gone undefeated in current season, in part thanks to a health regimen that emphasizes good sleeping habits; coach Pat Fitzgerald has used range of techniques and technology to track and improve his players' sleep.

headline.main: At Northwestern, ‘Caught Napping’ Can Be a Positive

docs.snippet: The police released a 17-minute call from a panicked Charlotte, N.C., homeowner that led to the death of Jonathan Ferrell, 24, at the hands of a police officer....
docs.lead_paragraph: The police released a 17-minute call from a panicked Charlotte, N.C., homeowner that led to the death of Jonathan Ferrell, 24, at the hands of a police officer.
docs.abstract: Police release recording of 911 call from panicked Charlotte, NC, homeowner that led to death of 24-year-old black man, Jonathan Ferrell, at hands of officer who shot him 10 times; lawyers for officer who fired shots, Randall Kerrick, have not yet entered plea on charges of voluntary manslaughter.

headline.main: In 911 Call, a Sequence to a Fatal Shooting
headline.print_headline: In 911 Call, A Sequence To a Shooting

docs.snippet: Tour Commissioner Tim Finchem expressed concern Tuesday about the format’s fairness, in part because some players, like Tiger Woods, tend to get more TV time than others....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tour Commissioner Tim Finchem expressed concern Tuesday about the format’s fairness, in part because some players, like Tiger Woods, tend to get more TV time than others.
docs.abstract: PGA policy board will reexamine rules that allow anyone, even TV viewers, to submit evidence of infractions by golfers that were not detected on the spot; Commissioner Tim Finchem notes that format may unfairly disadvantage players, like Tiger Woods, who are featured on television far more often than others.

headline.main: PGA to Discuss Reducing Viewers’ Impact on Penalties
headline.print_headline: PGA to Discuss Limiting Viewers’ Impact on Results
